title: A General Approach for Computing a Consensus in Group Decision Making That Integrates Multiple Ethical Principles. (arXiv:2401.07818v1 [econ.TH])
abstract: We tackle the problem of computing a consensus according to multiple ethical principles -- which can include, for example, the principle of maximum freedom associated with the Benthamite doctrine and the principle of maximum fairness associated with the Rawlsian principles -- among the preferences of different individuals in the context of Group-Decision-Making. More formally, we put forward a novel formalisation of the above-mentioned problem based on a multinorm approximation problem that aims at minimising multiple p-metric distance functions, where each parameter p represents a given ethical principle. Our contribution incurs obvious benefits from a social-choice perspective. translated_title: 计算集体决策中综合多个伦理原则的共识的一般方法
translated_abstract: 我们解决了在群体决策的背景下，根据多个伦理原则（例如，与本塔姆学说相关的最大自由原则和与洛尔斯原则相关的最大公平原则）计算共识的问题。我们提出了一个基于多规范逼近问题的创新形式化方法，该方法旨在最小化多个p度量距离函数，其中每个参数p代表一个给定的伦理原则。我们的贡献在社会选择的角度具有明显的好处。首先，我们的方法显着推广了仅针对两个伦理原则（p设置为1，用于最大自由；p设置为无穷大，用于最大公平）的最新方法。其次，我们的实验结果考虑了一个已建立的测试案例，证明了我们的方法的有效性。
tldr: 本论文提出了一种通用方法，可以根据多个伦理原则计算群体决策中的共识。该方法通过最小化多个p度量距离函数来解决问题，从而推广了现有的方法并在实验中得到验证。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a general approach for computing a consensus in group decision making according to multiple ethical principles. The approach extends previous methods by minimizing multiple p-metric distance functions and is validated through experimental results.
